P3 (Medium)¶

Problem statement¶

This problem was asked by Google.

Given the root to a binary tree, implement serialize(root), which serializes the tree into a string, and deserialize(s), which deserializes the string back into the tree.

For example, given the following Node class:

class Node:
def __init__(self, val, left=None, right=None):
    self.val = val
    self.left = left
    self.right = right

The following test should pass:

node = Node('root', Node('left', Node('left.left')), Node('right'))
assert deserialize(serialize(node)).left.left.val == 'left.left'

Docstrings¶

class src.prob3.Solution¶

docstring for Solution

deserialize(lst)¶
>>> s.deserialize(["root", None, None]).val
"root"
Parameters

lst – serialized binary tree

Returns

deserialized binary tree

serialize(root)¶

BFS traverse and serialize bianry tree

>>> s.serialize(Node("root"))
["root", None, None]
Parameters

root – Node root; root of a binary tree

Returns

A list contains the serialized binary tree.
